1 ^ Dòmine probavìsti me: 2 ^ tu cognovìsti sessiónem meam et resurrecțiónem meam~; intellexìsti coģitațiónes meas de longe. ^ Thou hast known my sitting down and my rising up~; thou hast understood my thoughts afar off.
3 ^ Sémitam meam et funìculum meum investigavìsti
thou hast proved me: ^ My path and my line thou hast searched out
and thou hast foreseen all my ways

1 ^ Dòmine probavìsti me: 4 ^ qŭia non est sermo in lingŭa mea. ^ for there is no speech in my tongue.

novìssima et antíqŭa~; tu formavìsti me
column5: et posuìsti super me manum tuam. ^ Behold
column8: the last and those of old~; thou hast formed me
column9: and hast laid thy hand upon me.

1 ^ Dòmine probavìsti me: 6 ^ Mirábilis facta est sciènția tua ex me~; confortáta est
et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: et non pótero ad eam. ^ Thy knowledge is become wonderful to me~; it is high
thou hast proved me: and I cannot reach to it.

et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: et qŭo a fáçie tua fúģiem~? ^ Whither shall I go from thy spirit
thou hast proved me: or whither shall I flee from thy face~?

et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: tu illic es~; si descènsero in infèrnum
thou hast proved me: ades. ^ If I ascend into heaven
thou art there~; if I descend into the depths

thou hast proved me: ^ If I take my wings early in the morning
and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea

1 ^ Dòmine probavìsti me: 10 ^ ètenim illûc manus tua dedúcet me
et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: et tenébit me dèxtera tua. ^ even there also shall thy hand lead me
thou hast proved me: and thy right hand shall hold me.
et nòx illumináțio mea in delìciîs meîs~»
column6: and night shall be my light in my pleasures
column7:
12 ^ qŭia tènebraĕ non obscurabùntur a te, et nòx sicut dies illuminábitur~; sicut tènebraĕ ejus, ita et lumen ejus. ^ but darkness shall not be dark to thee, and night shall be light all the day~; for just as its darkness is, so also is its light.
13 ^ Qŭia tu possedìsti renes meos~; suscepìsti me de útero matris meaĕ. ^ For thou hast possessed my reins~; thou hast protected me from my mother's womb.
14 ^ Confitébor tìbi, qŭia terribìliter magnificátus es~; mirabìlia ópera tua, et ánima mea cognóscit nìmis. ^ I will praise thee, for thou art fearfully magnified~; wonderful are thy works, and my soul knoweth right well.
15 ^ Non est occultátum òssu meum a te, qŭod fecìsti in occùlto, et substánția mea in inferióribus terraĕ. ^ My bone is not hidden from thee, which thou hast made in secret, and my substance in the lower parts of the earth.
16 ^ Imperfèctum meum vîdérunt òculi tui, et in lìbro tuo òmnes scribèntur~; dies formabùntur, et nemo in eîs. ^ Thy eyes did see my imperfect being, and in thy book all shall be written~; days shall be formed, and no one in them.
17 ^ Mìhi aŭtem nìmis honorificáti sunt amíci tui, Deus~; nìmis confortátus est principátûs eórum. ^ But to me thy friends are made exceedingly honourable, O God~; their principality is exceedingly strengthened.
18 ^ Dinumerábo eos, et super arénam multiplicábuntur~; exsurréxi, et adhûc sum tecum. ^ I will number them, and they shall be multiplied above the sand~; I rose up, and am still with thee.
19 ^ Si occáĕserîs peccatóres, Deus~; vìri sángŭinum, declináte a me, ^ If thou shouldst kill the wicked, O God~; ye men of blood, depart from me,
20 ^ qŭia dícitis in coģitațióne, «~Accìpient in vanitáte civitátes tuas.~»^ because you say in thought, They shall receive thy cities in vain."

et super inimícos tuos tabescébam~? ^ Have I not hated them
column7: and pined away because of thy enemies~?

et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: et inimíci facti sunt mìchi. ^ I have hated them with a perfect hatred
thou hast proved me: and they are become enemies to me.
et scito cor meum~; intèrroga me
et cognósce sémitas meas. ^ Prove me
column6: and know my heart~; examine me

1 ^ Dòmine probavìsti me: 24 ^ Et vède si via iniqŭitátis in me est
et cognovìsti me. ^ Lord: et dedúce me in via aĕtèrna. ^ And see whether the way of iniquity is in me
thou hast proved me: and lead me in the eternal way.
